data.title: The Wilkinson Family
data.text:
1. WILLIAM ARTHUR (Jr)

(1874-19.01.1955)

Eldest son, William Arthur (Junior) is standing hand in pocket. Willliam Arthur Wilkinson (Senior) (seated holding child) and wife, Emma (seated).

George Richard is standing on the left. Arthur Ernest is lying down in the front row.

William Arthur married Margaret Ann Williamson (1886-02.01.1956) on Dec 1 1903 – he eventually became the manager of the mineral water factory.

They had 13 children:

Emma (1904 – ?),

William Arthur (1906 – 22.09.1930),

Florence May (1908 – 13.12.2001)

Decima Elizabeth (1910 – ?)

Sydney Alwyn (c1912 – c1914)

Suzanne Maud (1914 – 1993)

Margaret Anne (1915 – 16.07.1998)

Constance Evelyn (1919 – 24.12.2008)

Ada (1922 – ?)

Leslie Alwyn (1924)

Noveen Olivia (1926)

Joan (1928)

Dorothy (b and d c1930)

William Arthur – was a seaman and died from pneumonia, TB and pleurisy aged 24 years. Buried at Harton Cemetery, South Shields

Sydney Alwyn – died about 2 year old don’t know what from and guessing at birth year. Believed buried at Westoe Cemetery, South Shields

Decima Elizabeth – died on the 14th December, year uncertain, from septicaemia following child birth.

Ada – died in childhood, age unknown.

Dorothy – only lived 1 week after she was born with spina bifida

7. ALFRED ERNEST (1884-28.6.1939)

He married Francis Coates Wharrier (1886-20.12.1951) in 1908. Their grave is in Preston Cemetery, North Shields just in front of WAW senior’s.

They had four children, Alfred Ernest (aka “Young Ernie”) (1908-1962), Winifred Mary (1910-1986), Matthew D (1911-1911), and Gertrude (1916)

Alfred Ernest married Mary Jane (“Jennie”) Dawson in 1933, without known issue. It is “Young Ernie” who took over the reins of the business when his father died in 1939.

After her husband’s death, Jennie moved to the Isle of Wight to work in a hotel. She later returned to Northumberland.

Photo shows l-r: Alfred Ernest, William Arthur (junior), George Richard?
